description: Meatless Monday: Avoid eating any meat for the entire day to lower your diet-related emissions.
Eat Local: Ensure at least one of your meals today consists entirely of locally sourced ingredients (within 100 miles).
Zero Food Waste Meal: Create a meal using ingredients that are close to expiring to prevent them from being wasted.
Eco-Commute: Use public transport, cycle, or walk for your commute today instead of driving a personal car.
Trip Chaining: Combine at least three separate errands into a single, efficient trip to reduce mileage.
Unplug Power Vampires: Identify and unplug 5 devices that consume standby power when not in use (e.g., chargers, TVs).
Natural Light Hour: For one hour during the day when you would normally have lights on, use only natural light.
No Single-Use Coffee Cups: For the entire week, use a reusable cup for all your hot beverage purchases.
Waste Audit Week: Keep a log of all the non-recyclable waste you produce this week to identify your main sources.
30-Day Purchase Pause: For one week, commit to not buying any new non-essential items (e.g., clothing, electronics, decor).
Second-Hand First: If you need to acquire an item this week, try to find it second-hand before buying new.
Share a Sustainability Tip: Share one practical sustainability tip you've learned with a friend, family member, or on social media.
Local Green Space Cleanup: Spend 30 minutes picking up litter at a local park, beach, or green space.
Master Home Composting: Over the next month, set up and successfully maintain a home composting system for your food scraps.
Energy Audit and Upgrade: Conduct a thorough energy audit of your home this month and implement at least one significant efficiency upgrade (e.g., adding insulation, upgrading an old appliance).
Hydrate with Tap Water: Avoid buying bottled water for the day. Use a reusable bottle and refill from the tap.
DIY Cleaning Product: Make one all-purpose household cleaner using simple ingredients like vinegar and water.
Mend a Garment: Instead of discarding it, repair one item of clothing that has a hole, missing button, or tear.
Air-Dry Laundry: Skip the dryer for one load of laundry and let it air-dry on a line or rack.
Check Tire Pressure: Ensure your car's tires are properly inflated, which can improve fuel efficiency by up to 3%.
Watch & Share a Doc: Watch a documentary on an environmental topic and discuss one thing you learned with someone.
Digital Cleanup: Spend 15 minutes deleting old, unnecessary files and emails from your cloud storage to reduce data center energy use.
Inbox Zero Hero: Unsubscribe from at least 10 marketing or promotional email lists you no longer read.
Grow Your Own Food: This month, start a small herb garden on your windowsill or a vegetable patch in your yard.
BYO Container: For one takeaway meal this week, bring your own reusable container to avoid single-use packaging.
Library Power: Borrow a book, movie, or game from your local library instead of buying a new one.
Lower the Thermostat: Lower your heating thermostat by 1 degree Celsius (or 2 degrees Fahrenheit) for the entire day.
Car-Free Weekend Day: Choose one day this weekend to leave the car parked and rely only on walking, cycling, or public transport.
Support a Green Business: Make a purchase from a local business known for its sustainable practices.
Mindful Streaming: Reduce your video streaming quality from HD to SD for your viewing session today.
Plant-Based Protein Swap: Replace the animal protein in one of your meals with a plant-based alternative like beans, lentils, or tofu.
Refuse the Receipt: Opt for a digital receipt or no receipt at all for your purchases this week.
Experience Over Things: Plan an experience with a friend or family member (like a hike or a picnic) instead of exchanging material gifts.
Energy-Saving Mode: Enable the energy-saving mode on your laptop or computer for your entire work session today.
Eco-Driving Practice: Consciously practice eco-driving techniques like smooth acceleration and braking during your trips today.
Write to a Company: Send an email or social media message to a company asking them about their sustainability practices or suggesting an improvement.
Switch to a Green Energy Provider: Research and make the switch to a renewable energy provider for your home's electricity.
Dark Mode Day: Use dark mode on your smartphone and computer for the entire day to save screen energy.
Finish Your Plate: Make a conscious effort to finish all the food on your plate for every meal today.
Paperless Week: Actively avoid printing any documents this week, opting for digital versions instead.
DIY Gift: For the next gift-giving occasion, create a homemade gift instead of purchasing a new item.
Shorter Shower: Time your shower today and aim to reduce it by at least two minutes.
Flight-Free Vacation Plan: Plan your next vacation to be reachable by train, bus, or car instead of by plane.
Join a Green Forum: Join an online community or forum dedicated to sustainability and read the top 5 posts.
Offline Evening: Spend at least two hours this evening completely offline, with all your digital devices turned off.
Seasonal Produce Only: For today's meals, only use fruits and vegetables that are currently in season in your region.
No New Plastic Bottles: For the entire week, avoid buying any beverages that come in single-use plastic bottles.
Borrow, Don't Buy: For a tool or item you need for a one-time use this week, borrow it from a friend, neighbor, or tool library.
Seal a Draft: Identify and seal one air leak or draft in your home, for example, under a door or around a window.
Lighten Your Load: Remove any unnecessary heavy items from your car's trunk to improve its fuel efficiency.
Volunteer for a Green Cause: Sign up for one hour of volunteer work with a local environmental organization.
Audio-Only Call: Choose to make one of your video calls today an audio-only call to save data and energy.
Reduce Dairy Intake: Replace dairy milk with a plant-based alternative like oat or soy milk for your cereal or coffee today.
Properly Dispose of E-Waste: Identify one piece of electronic waste in your home and find a proper local facility to recycle it.
Unfollow Fast Fashion: Unfollow five fast fashion brands on social media and follow five sustainable or second-hand fashion accounts instead.
Full Loads Only: Only run your dishwasher or washing machine when they are completely full.
Plan a Walkable Outing: Plan a leisure activity for the upcoming weekend that is reachable by foot from your home.
Contact a Local Representative: Write a short email to a local government representative about an environmental issue you care about.
Download, Don't Stream: For a piece of music or a podcast you listen to regularly, download it instead of streaming it multiple times.
Conduct a Home Waste Audit: For one month, track every piece of waste your household produces to identify key areas for reduction and improved recycling.
